Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a three-run home run in his playoff debut to tie the game at three apiece.
Teoscar Hern√°ndez ripped a two-run single to give Los Angeles a 6-5 lead
Pre-Game Insights: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said he wished other players had Shohei Ohtani's ability to come through in big moments.
General manager Brandon Gomes said they don't anticipate Ohtani pitching in the postseason.
Post-Match Reflections: Shohei Ohtani said he thoroughly enjoyed the intensity of the stadium before the game and admired the 372-foot shot as it made its way over right field and ran around the bases.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani accumulated a franchise-record 411 total bases in his history 54-homer, 59-steal season.
Ohtani's.310 batting average ranked second in the Senior Circuit.
Others: The game was played at Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles.
